intro: Scrophularia stenothyrsa, commonly known as narrow-throat scrophularia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Mediterranean region. It typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to purple, often attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, and it has a fibrous root system. Scrophularia stenothyrsa is part of the Plantaginaceae family, which includes many species with similar ecological and botanical characteristics.
